hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In ${\maroonD{9}} = \purpleC{{?}} \div \greenD{{6}}$, the $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{6}$.

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{9}}$.

![Tape diagram showing question mark is equal to 6 equal groups of 9](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d7c2700709200e98cc30f84e8ca6e17aa1cc6bb7)

The $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{?}$.

Tony can use these multiplication equations:

- $\purpleC{{?}} = \greenD{6} \times \maroonD{{9}} $
- $\purpleC{{?}} = \maroonD{9} \times \greenD{{6}}$

question.content:
Tony wants to use multiplication to solve $9 = {?} \div 6$.

**Which two multiplication equations can Tony use?**
